results.title: Hyper-Ballad
results.creator_credit: Firas Massouh, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Firas Massouh’s hunger for travel was started by his father who, as a communist activist, moved to Russia from Syria where he met his wife. With baby in tow, the family began a lifelong journey of travelling, which was continued by Firas when he decided to continue his father’s travels and move to Melbourne.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Firas Massouh, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Firas Massouh’s hunger for travel was started by his father who, as a communist activist, moved to Russia from Syria where he met his wife. results.title: Hello Darling
results.creator_credit: Mike Helal, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Mike Helal left Lebanon at the height of the war and migrated to Melbourne. Reluctant to leave, Mike started to see the beauty of his new home. Despite this, nothing deters him as he waits to be reunited with his loved one again.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mike Helal, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Footprints on the Mountains
results.creator_credit: Denise Mack, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: At age 11 Denise Mack is told secretly by her mother that her heritage isn’t Irish, that her grandfather was Lebanese and her grandmother, Chinese. Through this story, Denise journeys along the path of her ancestry to bring her closer to herself.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Denise Mack, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.creator_credit: Raymond Nashar, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Affliction of Memory
results.creator_credit: Zeina Zogheib, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: For Zeina Zogheib the aroma of coffee and the fragrant scent of gardenia bring memories of Lebanon flooding back. A place Zeina and her family fled, due to the ravages of war.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Zeina Zogheib, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Plastic economy: banking and technology
results.creator_credit: Tony Paice and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Shows the effects of technology on the banking industry and the future prospects for the industry and employees. Incorporates union, industry and business views.

results.title: Just a story
results.creator_credit: Diane O'Connor, Tony Paice, Barbara Boyd-Anderson and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: An attempt to show that storytelling is not just part of literature but is part of the everyday world around us and the ways in which we relate to each other. Demonstrates that our own experiences provide a rich source of information which may be drawn upon for the writing of stories.

results.title: [The Tatler social newsreel]
results.brief_description: This film was one of the many documentaries shot in Victoria by Efftee Studios in the early 30s. In this newsreel compiled and narrated by Peter Newmarch of “The Truth” newspaper and shot by Bert Nicholas, several Melbourne socialites are featured at various functions: a social party in South Yarra, the first official meeting of the Centenary Dog Club at the Melbourne Showground and Ron Cameron’s Riding School. NOTE: No titles included.

results.title: The Age of change
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Looks at the impact of technological change on the Melbourne newspaper ‘The Age’ and considers this change in terms of its effect on the people involved. Highlights the increasing competition at the desk of reporters and editors from electronic information systems, and the impact of technology on the once labour-intensive area of printing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: Factory to farm
results.brief_description: Shows the various stages in the manufacture of farm implements and machinery and their use on Australian wheat farms during the 1920s. An important film on Australian history, both from farming and the “Sunshine Harvester Factory” points of view. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
